intro: Delphinium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It features tall, erect stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, adorned with clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Delphinium alpinum is noted for its showy blooms and is a popular choice for gardeners seeking a dramatic, flowering statement plant.
